result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Margaret Zezza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mary Margaret Zezza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mary Margaret Zezza was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham May 18, 2015 - Defendant granted 123 days credit.

Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Concurrent but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF235.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF235.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to associate with Chad Anderson, Tonya Hampton or Tammy Nichels.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow through on any treatment and recommendations of Agent or outcome of AODA Assessment.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to participate in MRT.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham April 16, 2018 - The Court amends the sentence credit on 14 CF 235.  

-Consecutive to 14CF36.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF36

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be converted into a civil judgment.
DNA surcharge.

-Maintain mental health treatment.
-Follow any additional programming and treatment as recommended by the Agent.
-Random and regular testing.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

supervisions.notes:
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF36

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Mary Margaret Zezza appeared from jail. Case called at 10:10.  Includes 14CF36, 14CF235, 14CF479.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  PSI has been completed. Atty. Repka addresses THC usage in the PSI. ADA Nieskes makes statement regarding PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
In 14CF36:
- Sentence W/H
- 4 years probation concurrent with 14CF235 and 14CF479 and without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of revocation. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system,  on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting - Not to associate with son Chad Anderson, Tonya Hampton, and Tammy Nichels
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to use or possess firearms.
- DE to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- follow through with any treatment and follow through recommended by Agent or outcome of AODA assessment. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to participate in MRT.
- Costs

In 14CF235:
- Sentence W/H
- 4 years probation concurrent with 14CF36 and 14CF479 and without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of revocation. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system,  on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting - Not to associate with son Chad Anderson, Tonya Hampton, and Tammy Nichels
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to use or possess firearms.
- DE to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- follow through with any treatment and follow through recommended by Agent or outcome of AODA assessment. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to participate in MRT
- Costs

In 14CF479:
- W/H 4 years probation concurrent with 14CF235 and 14CF479 and without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of revocation. 
- Costs
Court reserves on credit for time served. Jail credit to be determined on each file by Atty's by April 22, 2015.
Filed by Atty Repka. Requesting an earlier sentencing date. Reviewed by SRN. km
Signed by SRN. Fax: DOC. c: DA and Atty. km
signed by Defendant and Attorney this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Mary Margaret Zezza appeared from jail. Case called at 9:08.   Includes 14CF36,14CF156, 14CF235 & 14CF479. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations and recommends a PSI and be bound by the PSI. Atty. Repka believes.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. In 14CF36 DE pleads G to C.t 1. In 14CF235 DE pleads G in Ct. 2. In 14CF479 DE pleads G in Ct. 1 DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct. 1  in 14CF36, guilty of Ct. 2 in 14CF235 and guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF479. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2,3 and 4 in 14CF36, 14CF156, Ct. 1 and 3 in 14CF235 and Ct. 2 and 3 in 14CF479. Court revokes bail and orders a PSI to be completed by by April 13, 2015. Atty. Repka addresses the court re: DE release prior to sentencing. ADA Nieskes makes statement and objects. Atty. Repka makes argument. Court maintains decision to revoke bail. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF36, 14CF156, 14CF235 and 14CF479:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
